 After the resounding success in the year 2013 of the previous album "Dead Surface", the Italian power-duo Public Domain Resource returns offering a more and more perfect and intriguing sound.
 "Six Years" is the new album released in 2015, specially planned for conquering big masses of eletro-listeners and electro-dancers by fourteen songs of great technological value in which Pietro Oliveri and Ugo Crescini combine modern Synthpop, IDM and Electro elements.
 The drum-programming mechanically and dynamically delineates energetic rhythmic sections, while the keyboards cerebrally draw synthetic projections and the vocals spread capturing melodies creating an aura of futurism. The cold rationality of electronics joins harmony and the desire of experimentation, edifying a sophisticated and original musicality destined to affirm the Public Domain Resource as new sonic explorers of the Italian avantgarde.
 This album is marked by brilliant intuitions and technological tactics designed to take a further step towards the highest approval ratings from an huge number of electro-connoisseurs: the target is now fully achieved
